intro: Ourisia macrocarpa subsp. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited ourisia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. The subspecies is distinguished by its larger fruit size compared to other subspecies within the species.
